Package org.tedros.fx.presenter.dynamic.decorator

Class TDynaViewSimpleBaseDecorator<M extends TModelView>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tedros.fx.presenter.decorator.TDecorator<TDynaPresenter<M>>
      • org.tedros.fx.presenter.dynamic.decorator.TDynaViewSimpleBaseDecorator<M>
  • Type Parameters:
    M -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.tedros.api.presenter.decorator.ITDecorator<TDynaPresenter<M>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TDetailFieldBaseDecorator, TDynaViewActionBaseDecorator, TDynaViewCrudBaseDecorator, TDynaViewReportBaseDecorator, TDynaViewSelectionBaseDecorator, TViewDecorator
    public abstract class TDynaViewSimpleBaseDecorator<M extends TModelView>
extends TDecorator<TDynaPresenter<M>>
implements org.tedros.api.presenter.decorator.ITDecorator<TDynaPresenter<M>>
    The basic decorator for TDynaView view.

    Sets up the view layout.

    Author:
    Davis Gordon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TDynaViewSimpleBaseDecorator()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addItemInTBottomContent​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the bottom of the content layout identified by the tBottomContent field.

      The bottom content pane is a StackPane in the bottom of a BorderPane called tContentLayout.
      void addItemInTCenterContent​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the center of the content layout identified by the tCenterContent field.

      The center content pane is a StackPane in the center of a BorderPane called tContentLayout.
      void addItemInTHeaderHorizontalLayout​(javafx.scene.Node... item)
      Add a Node in the horizontal header pane identified by the tHeaderHorizontalLayout field.

      The horizontal header pane is a HBox at the first position on the VBox called tHeaderVerticalLayout.
      void addItemInTHeaderToolBar​(javafx.scene.Node... item)
      Add a Node in the header tool bar identified by the tHeaderToolBar field.

      The header tool bar is a ToolBar at the second position on the HBox called tHeaderHorizontalLayout.
      void addItemInTHeaderVerticalLayout​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the vertical header pane identified by the tHeaderVerticalLayout field.

      The vertical header pane is a VBox inside a StackPane called tHeaderContent.
      void addItemInTLeftContent​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the left of the content layout identified by the tLeftContent field.

      The left content pane is a StackPane in the left of a BorderPane called tContentLayout.
      void addItemInTRightContent​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the right of the content layout identified by the tRightContent field.

      The right content pane is a StackPane in the right of a BorderPane called tContentLayout.
      void addItemInTTopContent​(javafx.scene.Node item)
      Add a Node in the top of the content layout identified by the tTopContent field.

      The top content pane is a StackPane in the top of a BorderPane called tContentLayout.
      void addPaddingInTBottomContent​(double top, double right, double bottom, double left)
      Set padding in the bottom content pane.
      void addPaddingInTCenterContent​(double top, double right, double bottom, double left)
      Set padding in the center content pane.
      void addPaddingInTLeftContent​(double top, double right, double bottom, double left)
      Set padding in the left content pane.
      void addPaddingInTRightContent​(double top, double right, double bottom, double left)
      Set padding in the right content pane.
      void setPaddingInTTopContent​(double top, double right, double bottom, double left)
      Set padding in the top content pane.
      void setViewTitle​(java.lang.String text)
      Set a title to the view.

      A view title is a Label node identified by ITDynaView.gettViewTitle().

      If the parameter was null this will use the title set up in @TPresenter{decorator= @TDecorator{viewTitle=''}} but if the given TModelView was not annotated with TPresenter or with a custom view annotation which contains a TPresenter a default string (TAnnotationDefaultValue.TVIEW_viewTitle) will be used.

      • Methods inherited from class org.tedros.fx.presenter.decorator.TDecorator

        getApplicationUUID, getPresenter, getScreenSaverPane, getView, setPresenter, showScreenSaver

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface org.tedros.api.presenter.decorator.ITDecorator

        decorate, getApplicationUUID, getPresenter, getScreenSaverPane, getView, setPresenter, showScreenSaver

        public void addItemInTHeaderVerticalLayout​(javafx.scene.Node item)

        The vertical header pane is a VBox inside a StackPane called tHeaderContent.

      • addItemInTHeaderHorizontalLayout

        public void addItemInTHeaderHorizontalLayout​(javafx.scene.Node... item)

        Add a Node in the horizontal header pane identified by the tHeaderHorizontalLayout field.

        The horizontal header pane is a HBox at the first position on the VBox called tHeaderVerticalLayout. By default the first position of this HBox is filled with a view title layout called tViewTitleLayout and the second position is filled with a tool bar called tHeaderToolBar.

      • addItemInTHeaderToolBar

        public void addItemInTHeaderToolBar​(javafx.scene.Node... item)

        Add a Node in the header tool bar identified by the tHeaderToolBar field.

        The header tool bar is a ToolBar at the second position on the HBox called tHeaderHorizontalLayout.

      • setViewTitle

        public void setViewTitle​(java.lang.String text)

        Set a title to the view.

        A view title is a Label node identified by ITDynaView.gettViewTitle().

        If the parameter was null this will use the title set up in @TPresenter{decorator= @TDecorator{viewTitle=''}} but if the given TModelView was not annotated with TPresenter or with a custom view annotation which contains a TPresenter a default string (TAnnotationDefaultValue.TVIEW_viewTitle) will be used.
